intro: Polygala subcollina, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, intricate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are arranged in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Polygala subcollina is a relatively small plant, usually reaching heights of less than 1 meter.
